meanings.sent1: The garbage can was whiffier than the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The old socks were much whiffier than the fresh laundry.
meanings.sent3: The whiffier smell from the gym bag made everyone hold their noses.
meanings.sent4: The whiffier stench in the alley made it unbearable to pass through.
meanings.sent5: The whiffier odor of the fish market lingered in the air for hours.

meanings.definition: Having a stronger smell than something else
meanings.sent1: The cheese was whiffier than the crackers on the plate.
meanings.sent2: The perfume she wore was much whiffier than the one I usually use.
meanings.sent3: The whiffier aroma of the bakery made my stomach growl.
meanings.sent4: The whiffier scent of the flowers in the garden filled the room with fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The whiffier fragrance of the coffee shop drew customers in from the street.

meanings.sent1: The butterfly was whiffier than the bee as it fluttered by.
meanings.sent2: The cat moved whiffier than the dog across the room.
meanings.sent3: The whiffier squirrel darted across the park, surprising the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The whiffier dancer glided across the stage with grace and agility.
meanings.sent5: The whiffier wind carried the leaves swiftly through the air.
